verses.verse: {Priceless Wisdom is Sourced in God} d "Surely there are mines for silver and places where gold is refined.
Iron is taken from the ground; {Or dry earth} and copper is smelted from ore.
Mankind limits the darkness as they search the deepest depths for ore {Lit. for darkest stone} in unfathomable darkness.
He sinks his shaft far from human habitations, in a place {The Heb. lacks in a place} forgotten by explorers; they hang on harnesses as they swing back and forth.
"While the ground produces food, underneath it is torn up and burning hot, {Lit. is turned up as by fire}
where stones are sapphire and gold dust can be found,
a place where birds of prey never fly, and the eyes of the falcon have never seen.
The proud beasts haven't walked there; lions have never passed over it.
"Using a flint, he thrusts his hand, overturning mountains by the roots.
He cuts a channel through the rocks, while his eyes search for anything of value.
He dams up flowing rivers, bringing hidden things to light."
{Wisdom is of Greater Value than Precious Stones} d "Where can wisdom be found? Where is understanding's home?
Mankind doesn't appreciate their value; and you won't find it anywhere on earth. {Lit. it in the land of the living}
The deepest ocean says, «It's not within me.'and the sea says, «You'll never find it with me.'
You can't buy it with gold, and its value cannot be calculated in silver.
It cannot be compared to gold from Ophir, {I. e. an ancient source of fine gold; cf. 1Chr 29:4} with precious onyx, or with sapphire.
It cannot be compared to gold and fine glass {The Heb. lacks fine glass} crystal, nor can it be exchanged for gold-plated weaponry. {Or for refined implements made of gold}
Don't even bother to mention coral and crystal wisdom is more valuable than a bag of rubies. {Or pearls}
It can neither be compared with the topaz of Ethiopia nor valued in comparison to pure gold."
{Wisdom is from God} d "From where, then, does wisdom originate? Where does understanding live? {Lit. Where is its place?}
It has been concealed from the sight of every living creature and hidden even from the birds in the skies.
Abaddon {I. e. the realm of eternal judgment in the afterlife} and death said, «We did hear a rumor about it.'
God understands how to get there; he knows where they live. {Lit. knows its place}
For he looks as far as the ends of the earth and sees everything under the sky. {Or under heaven}
"He imparted weight to the wind; he regulated water by his measurement.
He set in place ordinances for the rain; and determined the pathway for thunder that accompanies lightning. {The sound of a thunderbolt}
Then he looked at wisdom, and fixed it in place; he established it, and also examined it.
He has commanded mankind: «To fear the Lord that is wisdom; to move away from evil that is understanding.»"
